content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Iron Plate Production Setup (Position x=1-5, y=1-3)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at (1,1) and (3,1)
- Two wooden chests at (1.5,3.5) and (3.5,3.5) storing iron plates
- Three burner inserters at (1.5,2.5), (3.5,2.5), and (5.5,2.5) moving items from furnaces to chests
- Additional wooden chest at (5.5,3.5)

###Copper Plate Production Setup (Position x=2-4, y=7-9)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at (2,7) and (4,7)
- Two wooden chests at (2.5,9.5) and (4.5,9.5) storing copper plates
- Two burner inserters at (2.5,8.5) and (4.5,8.5) moving items from furnaces to chests

###Copper Cable Production Line (Position x=11-14, y=11-14)
Consists of:
- Assembling machine-1 at (14.5,14.5) set to produce copper cable
- Input wooden chest at (14.5,11.5)
- Output wooden chest at (11.5,14.5) storing copper cables
- Two burner inserters at (14.5,12.5) and (12.5,14.5) for material movement

###Electronic Circuit Production Line (Position x=21, y=12-15)
Consists of:
- Assembling machine-1 at (21.5,15.5) set to produce electronic circuits
- Input wooden chest at (21.5,12.5)
- Burner inserter at (21.5,13.5)

###Power Generation Setup (Position x=2-13, y=35)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at (2.5,35.5)
- Boiler at (7.0,35.5)
- Steam engine at (13.5,35.5)
- Two pipe groups connecting these components:
  - Water pipe system at (5.5,33.5)
  - Steam pipe system at (9.5,35.5)

###Research Setup
Consists of:
- Two labs with automation science packs loaded

ERROR TIPS

### Power connection errors
- Ensure power poles are within connection range of each other
- Place power poles close enough to connect electrical entities to the power network

### Fuel management errors
- Keep coal in inventory for inserting into boilers and burner inserters
- Regularly check and refuel burner inserters to prevent them from stopping

### Resource flow errors
- Ensure proper material flow between production stages
- Check if input chests have required materials for assembling machines to work

### Entity placement errors
- Verify that offshore pumps are placed adjacent to water
- Ensure fluid-carrying entities (pipes, boilers, steam engines) are properly connected in sequence

### Power network issues
- Create a complete power network connecting all electrical consumers (assembling machines, labs)
- Place power poles strategically to cover all electrical entities
